column4: no one can help at all with totem/mplayer not getting even to looking at the dvd drive?
all I wanna do is play a dvd :(
i got it
I have the same kind of problem, but I don't use my computer for DVDs anyway -- I don't have a /dev/dvd device file; Is that your problem too?
fuser /dev/dsp for instance. :)
thanks man..
add the -k switch, as root, to kill all processes using that device.
keeps coming up with errors - no matter what i do I cant umount it..?!?!
which errors, and which device are you doing it to?
says /dev/hdc dissagrees with fstab... just checking fstab now
says /dev/hdc dissagrees with fstab... just checking fstab now..
this is what happens when you issue the command: umount /dev/hdc ?
fstab says /dev/hdc is mounted on /media/cdrom0 - but thats not mounted( at least that's what it says when i try...
AH!?!
- this is going to sound a bit cheeky - but thats how i got here in the first place - eject says 'unmount od /dev/hdc/ failed.

bah. It's a pain sometimes. When 'eject' fails to work I either keep issuing the command until it decides to come around to my way of thinking ... or... and this is drastic... reboot and get the CD out at BIOS time. :(
- i trying to get a god uptime! trying to reduce my 'well a reboot will sort it out' attitude... :(
there's probably a way around it...
got it - kept trying, then it came up with a '(and you are not root) in a messge - went in again killing and fusering everything with sudo, and i'm in. (and it's out!)
w00t!
I've been thinking of getting one -- just to do vlc|mplayer -zoom tv:// -- sounds like fun. :)
